resources.string: This RSIS project is a continuum of an assessment of a completed rice seed information project of Region 3 as to its validity and essential aspects needing improvements to address the current and future technological advances. The common yet persisting problems in the rice seed system such as delayed data consolidation, analysis, and transmission on rice seed production and distribution are hoped to be addressed. Thru ICT and this RSIS, manual data gathering and processing posing higher risk of human errors, delay of information, or worse data loss may be reduced and/or eliminated.
RSIS is one of the programs of the Department of Agriculture, which aims to provide interventions at both national and local levels to support rice production.
Overseer of the implementation of the project; making sure that all resources are commendably being utilized.

BPI shall create interface and subsystem that could incorporate and integrate their current business processes (application for seed certification; preliminary and final inspection; seed analysis and tagging) in the system. Also, the bureau shall capacitate its staff such as seed inspectors, data officers, seed analysts, among others in using the modules and the system. The bureau with the help of SIs will also supervise the involvement of SPs in the system.

Generally, PhilRice shall design the system, and develop platforms that could gather field data (from seed production, monitoring to distribution). These developed platforms will continuously be enhanced until such time that the system is ready for nationwide deployment. The system shall be enhanced and redesigned (if necessary) based on the inputs and requirements of project partners and their sites during consultative meetings, FGDs, and pilot testing. The institute together with other implementers are also responsible for the success of system deployment, operationalization and sustainability nationwide.
